data:
Dr. Ming Sun Dr. Ming Sun Associate Professor, Physics &
                            Astronomy Department I have been fascinated by night sky since I was a little kid. I attended Harvard University for my Ph.D. in Astronomy. Following post-doctoral experience at Michigan State University and the University of Virginia, I was a research scientist at the University of Virginia and Eureka Scientific. I started at the UAH from the beginning of 2014. Dr. Ming Sun's personal webpage Dr. Ming Sun's Google Scholar webpage Ph.D., Astronomy, Harvard University, 2005 B.S., Nanjing University, China, 1997 2018 - Present: Associate Professor, Department of Physics and Astronomy, UAH 2014 - 2018: Assistant Professor, Department of Physics and Astronomy, UAH 2012 - 2013: Scientist VI, Eureka Scientific 2011 - 2012: Research scientist, University of Virginia AST 471 Astrophysics PH 789 Selected Topics AST 106 - Exploring The Cosmos I AST 107 - Exploring The Cosmos II AST 371 - Intro to Astrophysics PH 499 - Physics Practicum PH 571 - Stellar Physics PH 792 - Physics Seminar Chen, H., Sun, M. et al. 2020, The ram pressure stripped radio tails of galaxies in the Coma cluster, Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society, 496, 4654 https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2020MNRAS.496.4654C/abstract Liu, W., Sun, M. et al. 2020, AGN feedback in the FR II galaxy 3C 220.1, Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society, 492, 3156 https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2020MNRAS.492.3156L/abstract Jáchym, P., Kenney, J.
